name: Made's Bakery
address: Jl. Melang Kaja No.17, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: Top! Recomended ! we come here very often since we live nearby. both for lunch and dinner. very romantic. and they have a large selection of homemade cakes which are amazing. we take cakes with us almost every day. especially the food is very tasty, like homemade from grandma
review 2: a modest cafe, but I ate very tasty. a large selection of delicious desserts, the quality of the chocolate is good. I ate dumplings and pancakes, everything was fresh and delicious. The desserts, coconut candy and Syrok, were also very tasty. the service is pleasant.‚ù§Ô∏è
review 3:
Table is pretty hard to get as the place is small and popular.

We tried few positions on the menu and food was generally good but there wasn‚Äôt anything special about it
Favourite thing I tried was actually kids mash potatoes and sausages üòÑ

Tiny kids play corner is a big plus as well for families with small children üëç

*I am very sensitive to smells and I did not like the way it smelled inside ( not sure what it actually smelled of but it wasn‚Äôt very pleasant üôà)
review 4:
The most delicious desserts on Bukit.
We love this place for their delicious desserts, breakfasts. From what we tried, we liked the English breakfast, shakshuka, snickers cake, honey cake , chicken steak, cheesecake, eclairs, the coffee was also good.

But the meringue cake, napoleon we didn't like(üç∞

Met the hostess of the place.
We ordered a dessert from her for our birthday. Everyone liked the cake very much!

From the minuses:

The price tag on the dishes is a bit high, but I think it's because of the lack of competitors.
Also noticed that sometimes the floors are dirty, the bathroom, and the staff, when they work without a hostess as if working worse.

They forget, carry a long time, confuse the order.
I hope the owners will pay attention to thisüôèüèª
review 5:
Great local place for a tasty snack.
Service is good, cooking is sometimes slow and the place itself is quite basic.
But when I don‚Äôt feel like going to a favourite place this one just works fine.

name: Padma Pandawa Villa
address: Jalan Dharmawangsa, Gg. Jalak Putih, No.8, Kutuh, Kuta Selatan, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1: The rooms are comfy and clean. The atmosphere in this villa is peaceful. A good place to hang out with family or friends. The staff is helpful. Also the price is very affordable ‚ú®
review 2:
I was staying there 1 nights, the 3 bedroom private pool villa is big for 5 people. The price is very affordable.
the pool is bit dirty, but ok.
We ask some kitchen utensil, they provide us with extra charge.
The staff was very nice and helfull
review 3: Nice place for short terms rental. Villas not a big, each is 3 bedroom, small kitchen + small pool. Internet is good, but better in case when villa close to reception. Staff very nice and friendly. Villas are clean and bright. Not so many space, but if you come to Bali for traveling (not sitting in the villa) - it‚Äôs perfect variant. )
review 4: This scammers stole money from the villa from me and my friends
review 5:
For this price, nothing gets better than this.

Negative:
- insects gathers around the lights in front of the swimming pool. (It happened in early raining season, better than keep seeing lizard in canggu)
- location around this place are very quiet and it will be difficult if you don't have your own car or scooter.
- Could you provide hair dryer? It Will be very difficult for ladies to dry up their hair. And i don't think its expensive either.

Positive:
- The location are very quiet, the air are very fresh, i can see the stars on the sky. Perfect for people who want to spend quiet time.
- Private pool. Nothing gets better than this. Try to find another place like this at the same price.
- 3 bedroom villa. It's so spacious for big family. The building are new as well. I really like to have my meal in front of the swimming pool.
- Kitchen are fully loaded, other than stove, it comes qith everything you need. Toaster, microwave, water heater.
- The staff here are the champion. They are very responsive to the complain. Very friendly. I complained about the pool and access to the alley.
- Breakfast taste pretty good. I try their omelette, mie and nasi goreng. And it even comes with orange juice and watermelon.

I guess my biggest complain here are only hair dryer

name: OYO 91123 Madhava 108
address: 80362, Jl. Bali Harum No.16, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Bali, 80362, Indonesia
review 1: The staff was very rude and unfriendly, no owner phone numbers, even though there was a problem with my booking with OYO at that time, and they said that they no longer collaborated with Oyo itself since so long, but why is this place still registered with Oyo? Even my booking have confirmed and i have paid for it, it doesn't make any sense! And i just found out that this place have lot more problem with AGODA, OYO, or any others applications! A HIGHLY NOT RECOMMENDED! Just stay away from this place if you don't want to lose your money and time!!
review 2: AVOID AT ALL COSTS! After booking online through Agoda (with a booking reference and confirmation) we arrived and we‚Äôre told there is no booking for us. He said he had free rooms but we could only go in them if we paid double what we had originally thought we were paying. The man we spoke to was soo rude. Unhelpful. He just sat there watching instagram videos on his phone. We now have no where to stay. We will be telling anyone and everyone who listens how awful this place is.
review 3: DO NOT STAY - Booked through Agoda, and arrived and were told booking did not exist despite the man making no effort to look or help. He sat and watched instagram videos whilst we had to look for other accommodation. I spoke to the manager on the phone, who claimed he didn‚Äôt speak english, which was definitely a lie. Terrible service, avoid at all costs
review 4:
Cheap place to crash for a night but wouldn't stay again.

+ new furniture in rooms, clean,
+ super comfy bed
+ wifi does work
+ pretty green trees nature (if you are upstairs)

- not best location, far
- cold shower
- dogs bark through night and temple blasted an hour in morning (only 1 day out of 3 I stayed)
- teen boy staff I had to ask him to help me with my luggsgr
- pool is plunge, kid size
review 5: Denied check-in despite having booked and paid in advance. Staff said it's been happening for a month as they continue to take bookings despite being full. Staff didn't help with the refund, went through a lot of trouble to get the money back from the platform.

name: Umah Dayuh
address: Jl. Dharmawangsa Gg. Gelatik No.74B, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80831, Indonesia
review 1: Book the room bec pic looks nice and good reviews, however the room is very bad, too old and long time nobody stay, musty smell when open the door, the worst thing is the bed smell stink, money waste!
review 2: A great place to stay! So quiet to sleep, very comfortable (the king size beds) and the owners are wonderful. It felt like home and family üíì We stayed here few times, in total for 2.5 or more months. Good location to explore beaches and go surfing around. We will definitely come back to this homestay üòç
review 3: The owner lady is such a nice person and she makes you feel like home. Anything you need she will arrange and she is always smiling. I would definitely stay there again if I visit Uluwatu.
review 4: Will definitely stay here again when I visit Uluwatu. The owner was sooo helpful and went above and beyond to explain and give us recommendations for what to do in Bali ‚ù§Ô∏è thank you so much üôèüèΩ
review 5: Wonderful place, amazing host. I have been living at Umah Dayuh for 3 months and it was unforgettable. I have felt here like at home stay. Definitely will come back here again.

name: Kismet
address: Jl. Melang Kaja No.15, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
A great place for surfers and non-surfers alike. Kismet provides a safe sanctuary full of kind souls, a beautiful dog and a generous, welcoming and funny host!

If you are looking to stay somewhere where you will feel at home, look no further than Kismet. You will feel at home from the second you step through the door. The rooms are cosy and well-priced, the kitchen is well-stocked and nice to chill in, and there is also a small gym to use. Additionally, there is a cheap warung just next door which serves tasty local food.

Seriously, look no further than Kismet! You will not regret booking your stay here
review 2: Kismet became the home that I was missing on Bali. Sarah the host has this magic with her that makes you so so happy. Kismt itself is such a beautiful place. There is a garden and the open kitchen is like the heart of the community. This area is quiet and relaxed. You are so close to the most beautiful beaches and Uluwatu Center is not far away.
review 3: Such a wonderful place to stay. The rooms have nice big desks which are perfect if you need to do a bit of work. The kitchen is the hub and you'll always find the host Sarah or another guest there if you want to chill out and have a chat. Sarah supplies everything you need, medicines, cleaning supplies, toilet supplies and even some instant noodles for a late night feast. It's just a nice place to be and a really friendly vibe. I definitely recommend staying at Kismet and will be back for sure.
review 4: When you see travellers returning over and over again to the same hotel, you know it‚Äôs an excellent place to stay. This is a non-pretentious homestead and yet offers everything that you need: nice clean facilities, silence and a friendly chat every time you go to the kitchen area and find another guest, Sarah or Sir William (the most gentle dog in Bukit). The rates are affordable, and everything you need nearby: warungs, laundry, supermarkets and my favourite bakery in Uluwatu, Made. The region gives you old Bali vibes. If you are a solo traveller and/or digital nomad who needs silence and appreciate some company, this is your place!
review 5:
I recently stayed at Kismet in Bukit, and it honestly felt like a second home. Sarah, our host, was incredibly welcoming and kind. Kismet is a perfect spot for solo travelers, slow travelers, digital nomads, and surfers, and the credit for this goes to Sarah's warm and welcoming nature.

Sarah goes the extra mile to introduce guests to each other, making it easy to connect with fellow travelers from around the world. Even if you're an introvert like me, there's no need to worry ‚Äì you'll definitely make friends at Kismet. You can go surfing, diving, and party together, so you're sure to make lasting friendships here.

Also there's a working desk in the room and the environment is quiet , enabling you to focus on work.

One thing that stands out about Kismet is how Sarah takes care of her guests. She has even set up two surf racks in a shaded corner, keeping them away from the sun and showing she understands what matters to her guests. Moreover, Sarah genuinely cares about your well-being and your experience during your stay and takes the time to get to know each guest personally.

All in all, Kismet feels like a true home away from home. I highly recommend it to solo travelers, slow travelers, digital nomads, and surfers looking for an unforgettable experience.

name: 7 Heaven Villa
address: Jl. Mundeh No.a2, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Bali, 80361, Indonesia
review 1: I stay here 5 days and its amazing place with good service,I dont have problem with anything in this villa.. very recommended for stay with family
review 2: Amazing villa, with good price! Traditional but still modern and natural interior. Close with everywhere. Have pool, with nice light.  Friendly staff and have good breakfast
review 3: Perfect places for stay with family...I want back again when I come to Bali
review 4: worst place, 24 roosters crowing 24/7 right next to the wall, electricity constantly cuts out, there has never been any cleaning in 2 weeks, never live here

name: Tropical Pet Inn
address: Jl. Mundeh, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
The best dog hotel in Bali!‚ô•Ô∏è
I‚Äôve been using their services for other a year now. My dog is very happy here and I receive regular updates (photos/videos) which gives me peace of mind.
The owners Kevin and Debora are the kindest people you could meet! They are truly animal lovers and they always treat my dog as if was theirs.
So much gratitude!
review 2: The owner where super nice and friendly.. Huge space for my Pups to run around.. And lots of fuur friends to play with. She was over tired for one day play date hahaha. She slept for for hour after. Super great for your lazy pups  like mine ü§£
review 3: Best service ever, they‚Äôve been looking for our 4 dogs while we were back in Spain visiting our family, Kevin was sending pics of them and updating us very often making us very happy and relaxed seeing our dogs healthy and happy. Service Recommended 100%
review 4: Had our 5 month old puppy Sofie üê∂ stay for the first time. I can‚Äôt recommend this place enough, the service was so professional from beginning to the end. Very nurturing, caring and knowledgeable. When we went to pick her up, we was met with a very happy, freshly washed pooch. Amazing!
review 5: Kevin and Dwi clearly take their responsibilities seriously and very obviously love animals. A few points I appreciated include the huge and secure yard, strict daily routine, hands on approach to socialising the dogs, food quality, exercise regime and daily photos and messages. I wouldn't leave my canine family with anyone else when I have to travel for long periods of time.

name: Gita Bali House
address: Jl. Angsa Putih, Kutuh, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
Had a great stay with Gita. Extended two times:)

Excellent location for surfers - quick ride whether you want to surf Ulu or Nusa Dua, Balangan or Serangan. There's always a fast road to get there (don't listen to google maps and use local highways).

Villas are new and cozy, and have warm and positive energy:)
Owner Gita and his family are wonderful friendly people.

Gita used to work for 5* hotels so he knows exactly how to organize great experience for guests.
review 2:
Very convenient.

The location is very strategic (between Nusa Dua Area and Uluwatu Area).

Away from the crowds but easy to reach popular destinations such as GWK, Pandawa Beach, Timbis Beach, Paragliding, Nusa Dua Area, Uluwatu Area.
review 3: Wonderful place. Clean, very comfortable location. Friendly staff.
review 4: Nice and cozy place. Warm welcome and nice staff. Keep it up....2  thumb
review 5: Best Villa on south kuta bali , A very strategic place,for go to any tourism spot in the South Bali area
